verses.esv: 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask God, who gives generously to all without reproach, and it will be given him.
verses.kjv: 5 If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
verses.niv: 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, he should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to him.

verses.esv: 7 “Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
verses.kjv: 7 Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
verses.niv: 7 "Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.

verses.esv:
14   The heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge,
    but the mouths of fools feed on folly.
verses.kjv: 14 The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
verses.niv: 14 The discerning heart seeks knowledge, but the mouth of a fool feeds on folly.

verses.esv:
15   An intelligent heart acquires knowledge,
    and the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
16   A man’s gift makes room for him
    and brings him before the great.
17   The one who states his case first seems right,
    until the other comes and examines him.
18   The lot puts an end to quarrels
    and decides between powerful contenders.
19   A brother offended is more unyielding than a strong city,
    and quarreling is like the bars of a castle.
20   From the fruit of a man’s mouth his stomach is satisfied;
    he is satisfied by the yield of his lips.
21   Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
    and those who love it will eat its fruits.
22   He who finds a wife finds a good thing
    and obtains favor from the LORD.
23   The poor use entreaties,
    but the rich answer roughly.
24   A man of many companions may come to ruin,
    but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.kjv: 15 The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge. 16 A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men. 17 He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him. 18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty. 19 A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle. 20 A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled. 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof. 22 Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD. 23 The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly. 24 A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
verses.niv: 15 The heart of the discerning acquires knowledge; the ears of the wise seek it out. 16 A gift opens the way for the giver and ushers him into the presence of the great. 17 The first to present his case seems right, till another comes forward and questions him. 18 Casting the lot settles disputes and keeps strong opponents apart. 19 An offended brother is more unyielding than a fortified city, and disputes are like the barred gates of a citadel. 20 From the fruit of his mouth a man's stomach is filled; with the harvest from his lips he is satisfied. 21 The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit. 22 He who finds a wife finds what is good and receives favor from the LORD. 23 A poor man pleads for mercy, but a rich man answers harshly. 24 A man of many companions may come to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

verses.esv:
10   The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom,
    and the knowledge of the Holy One is insight.
verses.kjv: 10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
verses.niv: 10 "The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

verses.esv:
7   The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge;
    fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.kjv: 7 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.niv: 7 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline.

verses.esv:
6   For the LORD gives wisdom;
    from his mouth come knowledge and understanding;
verses.kjv: 6 For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
verses.niv: 6 For the LORD gives wisdom, and from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.

verses.esv:
6   My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge;
    because you have rejected knowledge,
    I reject you from being a priest to me.
  And since you have forgotten the law of your God,
    I also will forget your children.
verses.kjv: 6 My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge: because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee, that thou shalt be no priest to me: seeing thou hast forgotten the law of thy God, I will also forget thy children.
verses.niv: 6 my people are destroyed from lack of knowledge. "Because you have rejected knowledge, I also reject you as my priests; because you have ignored the law of your God, I also will ignore your children.

verses.esv:
5   A wise man is full of strength,
    and a man of knowledge enhances his might,
verses.kjv: 5 A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
verses.niv: 5 A wise man has great power, and a man of knowledge increases strength;

verses.esv:
2   Desire without knowledge is not good,
    and whoever makes haste with his feet misses his way.
verses.kjv: 2 Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
verses.niv: 2 It is not good to have zeal without knowledge, nor to be hasty and miss the way.

verses.esv: 17 that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give you the Spirit of wisdom and of revelation in the knowledge of him,
verses.kjv: 17 That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him:
verses.niv: 17 I keep asking that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the glorious Father, may give you the Spirit of wisdom and revelation, so that you may know him better.

verses.esv:
15   An intelligent heart acquires knowledge,
    and the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
verses.kjv: 15 The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
verses.niv: 15 The heart of the discerning acquires knowledge; the ears of the wise seek it out.

verses.esv:
5   Let the wise hear and increase in learning,
    and the one who understands obtain guidance,
verses.kjv: 5 A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
verses.niv: 5 let the wise listen and add to their learning, and let the discerning get guidance-

verses.esv: 22 But be doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves.
verses.kjv: 22 But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.
verses.niv: 22 Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says.

verses.esv:
10   The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom;
    all those who practice it have a good understanding.
    His praise endures forever!
verses.kjv: 10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endureth for ever.
verses.niv: 10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow his precepts have good understanding. To him belongs eternal praise.

verses.esv: 17 But the wisdom from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, open to reason, full of mercy and good fruits, impartial and sincere.
verses.kjv: 17 But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.
verses.niv: 17 But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure; then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere.

verses.esv:
27   Whoever restrains his words has knowledge,
    and he who has a cool spirit is a man of understanding.
verses.kjv: 27 He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
verses.niv: 27 A man of knowledge uses words with restraint, and a man of understanding is even-tempered.

verses.esv: 8:1 Now concerning food offered to idols: we know that “all of us possess knowledge.” This “knowledge” puffs up, but love builds up.
verses.kjv: 1 Now as touching things offered unto idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.
verses.niv: 1 Now about food sacrificed to idols: We know that we all possess knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up.

verses.esv: 18 But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be the glory both now and to the day of eternity. Amen.
verses.kjv: 18 But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.
verses.niv: 18 But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and forever! Amen.

verses.esv:
3   Talk no more so very proudly,
    let not arrogance come from your mouth;
  for the LORD is a God of knowledge,
    and by him actions are weighed.
verses.kjv: 3 Talk no more so exceeding proudly; let not arrogancy come out of your mouth: for the LORD is a God of knowledge, and by him actions are weighed.
verses.niv: 3 "Do not keep talking so proudly or let your mouth speak such arrogance, for the LORD is a God who knows, and by him deeds are weighed.

verses.esv: 6 And without faith it is impossible to please him, for whoever would draw near to God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.
verses.kjv: 6 But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.
verses.niv: 6 And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.

verses.esv: 33 Oh, the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are his judgments and how inscrutable his ways!
verses.kjv: 33 O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!
verses.niv: 33 Oh, the depth of the riches of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable his judgments, and his paths beyond tracing out!

verses.esv: 33 But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.kjv: 33 But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.niv: 33 But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.

verses.esv: 2 that their hearts may be encouraged, being knit together in love, to reach all the riches of full assurance of understanding and the knowledge of God’s mystery, which is Christ, 3 in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.kjv: 2 That their hearts might be comforted, being knit together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the acknowledgement of the mystery of God, and of the Father, and of Christ; 3 In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.niv: 2 My purpose is that they may be encouraged in heart and united in love, so that they may have the full riches of complete understanding, in order that they may know the mystery of God, namely, Christ, 3 in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

verses.esv:
11   Seek the LORD and his strength;
    seek his presence continually!
verses.kjv: 11 Seek the LORD and his strength, seek his face continually.
verses.niv: 11 Look to the LORD and his strength; seek his face always.
